course_title: Special Topics in ENVS: Perspectives on Anthropocene
class_notes: In this class, we will introduce facets of the Anthropocene from various perspectives (Geology, Biosphere, Technology, Society, Narratives, Inequity and Sustainability, Transformations and Resilience), followed by conversations with diverse Emory faculty presenting their disciplinary and inter-disciplinary perspectives. The final 1/3 of the class will be devoted to students presenting perspectives of the Anthropocene from the point of view of various constituencies: plants, animals, soil, water, air, cities, agriculture, transportation, social/demographic human groups, locations, artists, natural scientists, humanities. Each student (or small groups of students) will pick one perspective, and prepare a short paper and class presentation/session delivered from that perspective.
course_description: This is a variable topics course.
